p: There are herbs, shrubs, and, rarely, trees that usually grow in xeric and saline areas. This plant group comprises approximately 250 species grouped into around 25 genera that are distributed mainly in tropical to subtropical zones, with some representatives in temperate areas, especially in dry Mediterranean regions. Within this family, there are timber and medicinal species ( Guaiacum spp.) and several grown as ornamental plants ( Tribulus spp. and Zygophyllum spp.).
